Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| Exercise-induced ST depression |
| Myocardial Infarction (MI) |
| - Non-MI group |
| - ANT-MI group |
| - INF-MI group |

Explanation:

* Exercise-induced ST depression is a condition where the electrocardiogram (ECG) shows a depression in the ST segment during or after exercise. It can be a sign of cardiac ischemia or damage.
* Myocardial Infarction (MI) is a disease characterized by the death of a portion of heart muscle due to lack of blood supply to the heart.
* Non-MI, ANT-MI, and INF-MI are groups of people with different types of MI. Non-MI likely refers to non-ST segment elevation myocardial infarction, ANT-MI to anterior wall MI, and INF-MI to inferior wall MI. These are subtypes of MI based on the location of the heart damage.
